sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SLUCZK, a large and populous town in Poland, in Lithuania, and capital of a duchy of the ſame name ; famous for three battles gained here by Conſtantine duke of Oſtrog over the Tartars, in the reign of Sigiſmund I. It is ſeated on the river Sluczk, 72 miles ſouth-eaſt of Minſki, and 70 ſouth of Novogrodeck. E. Long. 27. 44. N. Lat. 53. 2.
